DataElement.preferredName: Bone Marrow Karyotyping Laboratory Procedure Cytogenetic Analysis Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a bone marrow karyotyping cytogenetic analysis was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bone Marrow Karyotyping Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes._Mapping of the full chromosome set of the nucleus of a cell. The chromosome characteristics of an individual or a cell line are usually presented as a systematized array of metaphase chromosomes from a photomicrograph of a single cell nucleus arranged in pairs in descending order of size and according to the position of the centromere. (From Stedman, 25th ed)_Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.:Mapping of the full chromosome set of the nucleus of a cell. The chromosome characteristics of an individual or a cell line are usually presented as a systematized array of metaphase chromosomes from a photomicrograph of a single cell nucleus arranged in pairs in descending order of size and according to the position of the centromere. (From Stedman, 25th ed):Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The preparation, analysis, and interpretation of a karyotype, the representation of the chromosome set of a cell.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.: Unable to be evaluated.: Arrangement of chromosomes in the equatorial plane of the central spindle to form the monaster.  Chromosomes separate into exactly similar halves. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The second phase of mitosis, in which the chromosomes line up across the equatorial plane of the spindle prior to separation.
